5.31.20  9:26 am   why is playing the blame game so fun

      it's thrilling to think that the other person might win

5.31.20  9:05 am   i am a very proficient musician but for some reason i just can't hit a note properly with my voice... did you have to work on your vocal skills in order to sing as well as you can? 

      put it this way, i had to do a lot of singing less good before i could sing as good as i can

5.31.20  8:10 am   How do learn quantum mechanics without questioning life and becoming a lunatic locked up in a mental asylum? 

      the trick is, if you learn it good enough, no one should be able to lock you in anywhere

5.31.20  8:08 am   hey bill what's a good senior quote

      'i hope you are enjoying this yearbook so far, and i hope it brings you even more joy and pleasure with each page turn.'

5.31.20  5:55 am   this is very random but please hear me out: i've always felt an unexplainable hatred for the randomest things. you seem like someone that can empathise,

     ......maybe not

      so please tell me - is it normal to HATE the multiplication 7 x 9 = 63?? i'm not sure why but i hate it so much, it just doesn't make sense to me.

     yes that one is kinda weird, but i can suggest: it may become a little more friendly once you realize you can take 8x8=64 and you can reduce the result by 1, just by taking the numbers on either side of 8, instead of 8. this is true of any square number. you can get one lower result by using the numbers on either side of the square root, instead of the square root

     i also feel an immense dislike for the zapfino font,

     yes i will admit that one seems a little inappropriate

      as well as the word 'meatball'. some other things that disgust me include people who write '(:' instead of ':)', people who type up stories and stuff in helvetica as a default instead of times new roman, and people who write the letter 'S' starting from the bottom. please tell me i'm not the only one who hates the most mundane things like these. if you cannot relate at all, then uh,, idk i guess im just messed up. :D

      it sounds like the general quality of your life over all must be very good

5.31.20  5:54 am   I have been up for 48 hours now and I'm starting to think that my lawn gnome is talking to me. What should I say?

      ah, this is a perfect chance for you to lie down for just 1 minute, while you think of something to say. lying down, even just for 1 minute, will give you a lot of great ideas. i'm pretty sure it will help you come up with the perfect thing that that gnome is supposed to say

5.31.20  5:20 am   how to tell if x is the bpm for your track, and not maybe x-1 or x+2, is there any way in which you feel differently in such small shifts? is it a different body feel? do you sway to click tracks? get the bpm just right to the sway? and not try to guess the sway at every bpm?

      just use a tap tempo button, play it for about 8 bars while glancing at it periodically during that time, then that should give you an idea. then test it around there and listen to it for about 8 to 16 bars, then test some of the surrounding tempos. then just stick with it. because it will be kind of dicey to try to change it later, at least after any audio waves have been recorded

5.31.20  5:13 am   Do you hate capitalism?

      i'm not even sure if i know what that is

5.31.20  5:12 am   Do you like eggs if so what type?

      HATCHED

5.31.20  4:04 am   how do you make your videos? 

      we'll see

5.31.20  3:49 am   So...i've been wondering...

How long does it take you in average to code stuff in blender?

     code what

     And what was the shortest and longest time so far?

      i could do an undo push, just by pressing this button: bpy.ops.ed.undo_push(). so that took about a half second. that puts an undo step into the script, so that way when you perform the 'undo' command, it will stop there and not blow right by that point in the process. The longest time to come up with code for something would be something i am still working on

5.31.20  3:46 am   If bread is bread, then what is milk??

5.30.20  7:34 pm   You are a very funny and interesting person. My question is what trauma led you to becoming like this?

5.30.20  7:20 pm   What are you doing staying up all day and night?

      if i have stayed up all day, that usually means i have slept all of the previous night. and if i am up all night, it usually means i have slept during all of the previous day. hope that makes sense

5.30.20  7:07 pm   i wanna make music but i dont know where to start. how did you start making music

     i don't remember. as far back as i can remember, i already was

     and how should i

     i think if you have some type of piano keyboard, that will help. and if you have a lot of song recordings that you like, that will help too. the real magic is when you try to bring those together -- try to recreate some of the songs and melodies you've heard from the recordings, on the instrument

5.30.20  7:01 pm   Do you have more time on your hands from the Coronavirus or not?

      put it this way....... i no longer go out to lunch

5.30.20  7:00 pm   What are fish?

      some type of bird plane, of the sea

5.30.20  6:37 pm   do you ever feel like youve got a mix down pat but then you listen to the result over a phone speaker and it sounds awful? im working with making purposefully lobit music and theres a couple of tunes that sound lovely through headphones and proper speakers but absolutely dire through phone speakers, like theres this horrible harsh scraping sound made whenever a mid/high frequency tone plays. have you any tips on this stage of the mixing process? any compromises i should consider?

      just be aware that nothing in the low frequency range will exist on the phone. also another thing to help put it in perspective, if someone mostly listens to music through a pancake speaker (phone speaker, tablet speaker, something flat like a pancake, with no bass, etc), they might be used to that sort of sound. so while you might be shocked, a certain amount of that is just you being shocked about the sound of the speaker. but that being said, you should also try to avoid any situations where the only significant thing happening is a low frequency thing. Another approach, which i used to swear by before i actually tried it, is starting your entire arrangement on a pancake soundsystem. or just make an EQ pancake simulation, like this. I would recommend doing that IF you think your audience will ONLY listen to it through the pancake, and never with anything else. but if you know that some of the audience will be hearing the bass, then you're gonna have to go back in and fix major problems because your bass will probably be exploding. I've tried this strategy once and it didn't go well. I think the best solution is to have an easy switching system where you can check the pancake, regular, and just check many types of speakers very quickly, at all times during production, including at the very beginning when you are first starting the arrangement
